lines.gurmukhi: gurisK sMgiq imlwp ko pRqwp Aiq pRym kY prspr pUrn pRgws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Gursikh Sangati Milaap Ko Prataap Ati , Praym Kai Parasapar Pooran Pragaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Significance of meeting of Guru and Guru-oriented men is limitless. Because of deep love in the heart of the Sikh of the Guru, light divine then glows in him.

lines.gurmukhi: drs AnUp rUp rMg AMg AMg Cib hyrq ihrwny diRg ibsm ibs√çws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Daras Anoop Roop Rang Ang Ang Chhabi , Hayrat Hiraanay Drig Bisam Bisvaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Seeing the beauty of the True Guru, His form, colour and image of His every limb, the eyes of a Guru-loving person are astonished. It also generates craving in his mind to see and behold the True Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd inDwn Anhd runJun Duin sunq suriq miq hrn AiBAws hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Nidhaan Anahad Rounajhoun Dhouni , Sounat Surati Mati Haran Abhiaas Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By inexhaustible practicing of meditation on Guru's words, a soft and mellow tune of unstruck music appears in the mystical tenth door. Perpetual hearing of it causes him to remain in a state of trance.

lines.gurmukhi: diRsit drs Aru sbd suriq imil prmdBuq giq pUrn iblws hY ]284]
lines.transliteration_english: Drisati Daras Aru Sabad Surati Mili , Paramadabhout Gati Pooran Bilaas Hai ?284?

Shabad OS B.translation: By focusing his vision in the True Guru and keeping the mind engrossed in the teachings and sermons of the Guru, he acquires a state of perfect and complete bloom. (284)
